questions.question: How do you translate a design prototype (e.g., from Figma or Adobe XD) into functional, responsive code?
questions.canonical_answer: I break the design into components, use semantic HTML, apply modular CSS or utility classes, and ensure layouts adapt with responsive breakpoints.

questions.question: Which front-end frameworks or libraries do you use most often, and why?
questions.canonical_answer: I use React, Vue, or Angular for their reusable components, strong ecosystems, and efficient state management.

questions.question: How do you ensure consistency in design across multiple components or pages?
questions.canonical_answer: I use design systems, shared component libraries, global styles, and follow established UI patterns.

questions.question: What is your approach to building responsive and cross-browser compatible interfaces?
questions.canonical_answer: I use flexible layouts, media queries, modern CSS features, and test across major browsers and devices.

questions.question: How do you optimize UI performance for faster loading and smoother interactions?
questions.canonical_answer: I minimize bundle size, lazy-load assets, optimize images, reuse components, and reduce unnecessary re-renders.

questions.question: How do you handle accessibility (a11y) in your UI components?
questions.canonical_answer: I use semantic HTML, ARIA roles, proper color contrast, keyboard navigation support, and screen reader-friendly labels.
